intro: Kochia pentagona, commonly known as the pentagon leaf kochia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other plants like spinach and beets. Kochia pentagona is also known for its ability to produce a fluffy seed head that resembles a dandelion, aiding in its dispersal.
